message: Use one fewer refinements by default for a quick test
Fix new examples for --enable-complex
Generalize PETSc-specific example code
Generalize PETSc-specific comments
Some more cleanup of the new examples
The new examples require 2D support
Include header for numeric_limits directly
If someone tries to load a mesh of unsupported dimension  a sensible error at read time is better than a nasty error during postprocessing
Removing DiffContext::request_jacobian - DiffSystem never got around to making it non-redundant or even using it  and the other systems might never want to use it.
Fixing bugs in Exodus writer/Iterators must be used if elements are deleted in the mesh
A few more iterator updates in the Exodus interface
Fixes from Roman Vetter for data imprecision  bugs in VTK output
Remove excess chatter from VTK output
Added ex28: Subdomain-Restricted Variables  from Ben

Checking in a major revision to rbOOmit. 1) Added RBEvaluation (and subclasses)  which factors out the parts of RBSystem needed to perform an RB_Solve. 2) Added RBComponent and related classes which allows us to connect RB models together using a substructuring approach.
small fix for complex number support
these rbOOmit classes need some more work first...
updated config.guess and support for gcc-4.6
Fix compilation failures in no-slepc  no-glpk cases
Copy associated BoundaryInfo when copying any Mesh
Changed initialize_calN_dependent_data to initialize_mesh_dependent_data  a more descriptive name. Also  small change to argument list for constructors in (QN)TransientRBEvaluation.
Fix for Tet10::has_affine_map() based on patch from Johannes Huber
Patch from Roman Vetter for (serial) VTK output of parallel data.
Patch based on Vikram Garg's work to enable patch recovery of seminorm errors based on individual gradient components
Don't let virtual functions get called indirectly from non-leaf constructor.
Switch a couple non-adaptive examples to VTKIO now that that works in parallel.
Fix for uses of topological_neighbor() that could break down on some partitionings.
Checking in David Andrs' changes to PetscVector for detecting whether the type is ghosted or MPI.
VTKIO fix for LIBMESH_DIM < 3
PetscVector changes compilation fix
Support PETSc 2.x.x where VecType was #define'd to "const char*". This changed in 3.0.0 to be char*.
Moving some const initializations to headers  and where appropriate changing external to internal linkages - there's no reason not to let compilers do a little better job optimizing here.
Needed to include string.h for gcc version 4.4.3
Make sure the square of the residual dual norm is non-negative
Added LAPACK-based svd to DenseMatrix
PETSc convergence reasons patch from Roman Vetter
Patch from Roman Vetter (and comments from myself) allowing System::project_vector to handle new element creation
Get rid of a magic number  sign conversion warning
Compilation fix for --enable-complex
In PETSc versions less than 3  don't name input parameter to avoid unused parameter warnings from compiler.
We're using std::set in periodic_boundaries.h now
Make these headers pass the test_headers.sh script.
Fixed shell coloring for Mac systems  may have been using a linux-specific syntax before?
This class must be #ifdef'd out if SLEPC and GLPK are not available  since it depends on QNTransientRBSystem  which is also #ifdef'd out if those classes are not available.
Added CondensedEigenSystem  which solves eigenvalue problems with specified dofs removed. This is convenient for solving eigenvalue problems with Dirichlet boundary conditions  for example.
Added transpose matvec function to DenseMatrix  with BLAS support.

Removed non_dirichlet_dofs_vector from RBSystem  it's now stored in CondensedEigenSystem. Cleaned up CondensedEigenSystem::solve(). Also  we now loop over local dofs in CondensedEigenSystem::initialize_condensed_dofs in order to set up the list of non condensed dofs.
NewtonSolver can exit line search early if it's only looking for finite residuals and it's already got one.
Fix for iteration count reporting when maximum iteration count is reached
Added n_global_non_condensed_dofs() to CondensedEigenSystem.
Replaced this->clear() call at end of solve().
Reverting recent projection change - it was skipping newly added elements  but it was also skipping other elements it shouldn't have.
David added exodus flush commands in several places.
Throw an error if the output directory hasn't already been created in RBSystem::write_output_data_to_files
clean up compiler warnings based on buildbot feedback
clean up compiler warnings based on buildbot feedback

PetscMatrix::print_personal now prints to file when requested (rather than just cout).  The implementation is not particularly efficient (since print_personal gets passed an ostream) but it does work.  And how efficient do you need to be if you are printing out matrices anyway?
Adjoints examples : Removed some now-redundant casts

Replacing dynamic_cast with libmesh_cast where appropriate - depending on the error checking replaced this will either lead to slightly more efficient NDEBUG runs or slightly more run-time checking in debug mode runs.
Refactoring examples slightly
Moving libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_ids() to MeshBase - in the long run we might want a SerialMesh implementation of this too  in the short run it makes ParallelMesh testing code less convoluted.
Use an actual defined FEMNormType in comment...
fixed colors
renamed user-provided function pointers to include _function on the end for clarity
gcc-4.6 syntax clarification suggestion
svn keyword expansion
64-bit tecplot API library
svn keyword expansion
Make sure libmesh_cast_ptr() has been defined
Specifying libMesh namespace  we can't guarantee a using statement will precede this file.
Adding missing namespace libMesh
Add a "using namespace libMesh" to apps for when it's disabled in headers
Print more informative messages about which includes are being removed  and use a more consistent/correct method to test-compile the files.
Get away with only a forward declaration of Partitioner in mesh_base.h.
Build debug-only virtual functions even in non-DEBUG modes  or Boyce & John see messed up vtables and strange errors when DEBUG and non-DEBUG object files are mixed.
Use libmesh_CPPFLAGS when building example object files too
Fixing Petsc 3.1.0 logic error in libMesh
Examples can now be built in parallel with "make -jN examples".
Added non_dirichlet_inner_product_matrix and an accessor in RBSystem
SparseMatrix::print() can now optionally print in a sparse format.
Added code to read in the boolean initialize_mesh_dependent_data from file
Fix for overzealous assertion that could be triggered on some BoundaryMesh elements
Re-bootstrapped with newer autotools  so that change won't obscure real changes to follow
Added a test for xz compression
Support for xz file compression
Provide access to raw SNESConvergedReason from PetscNonlinearSolver.
Using a virtual method instead of a dynamic cast
Use a virtual function rather than a dynamic cast for fix_broken_numbering calls
Elem::side() can return an Elem pointer  since it never produces a DofObject.  This means we don't need a virtual operator== in DofObject since we never need to compare a Node to an Elem.
libMesh can now work even when configured with -fno-rtti
Reverting until John can track down some regressions in INL's tests
Reinstating Friday's changes  but with the Parameters::have_parameter behavior (in a HAVE_RTTI context) restored to prevent MOOSE regressions
Added fix suggested by Vetter Roman.
Added a utility for comparing two restart files

Modified the write_offline_data_to_files and read_offline_data_from_files methods in rbOOmit. They now take an extra argument (with default value ALL_DATA) that indicates whether we should write out all the data  or just the basis function (in)dependent subset. Also  the greedy_params vector has been moved from RBSystem to RBEvaluation since each basis is generated with a different set of greedy parameters in general.
Separators in ASCII Xdr::data(vector) output
Semicolons are our friends.
Fixed missing STOP_LOGs in some of the RB classes.
Added add_vector_transpose to NumericVector  which computes A^T * v
Made attach_output virtual in RBSystem.
Added Jed Brown's patch fixing MatZeroRows for PETSc 3.1.1+
Jed Brown's updated ISCreateLibMesh patch.
Forward Partitioner declaration was causing some compiler warnings
Fix for error message
Added a short-circuit for RBSystem::compute_output_dual_norms when we don't have any outputs
Fixing VTKIO memory leak/memory corruption bugs  moving an unnecessarily heap'ed array to the stack.
Bugfixes for ParallelMesh  plus a more general correction to the last VTKIO fix
object-based assembly etc...
Use standard C++ string conversion and parsing instead of the sort-of-standard C functions that were giving Cygwin trouble
support for object-based QOI functions and derivatives
still need stdarg.h for variable-length arguments
string.h needed for strcmp  strncmp  strlen  strncpy

Changed default output data format for RB output vectors  they are now written to a single file outputs.dat by default  rather than to multiple files. The boolean multiple_files_for_outputs in RBEvaluation controls whether we write to a single file or multiple files.
Do parallel_only verification on libMeshInit
Revert to strtok_r for now
An fopen failure isn't an internal problem to assert away  it's something to always test and potentially throw a file error exception for.
setting CC_TRY_LIST and then overwriting it is not a good idea...
Replaced usage of strtok_r with std::string operations.  strtok_r is deprecated on some systems and is not available on some flavors of Cygwin.
include <time.h>  this error was discovered on cygwin.
Some small changes to the RB classes. In particular  made residual_scaling_denom return alpha_LB rather than sqrt alpha_LB  since that is the appropriate default for a coercive problem.
Remember to read comments off of the end of vector<complex> data
Detect Intel v12 compilers
Changed add_new_rb_evaluation_object so that it returns a pointer to the newly added RBEvaluation object.
Disable example VTKIO(ParallelMesh) output until we can get that working
Disable adaptive coarsening examples when --enable-parmesh is on until that bug is fixed

Bug fixes and workarounds for serial output of ParallelMesh.  We no longer require the user to allgather() by hand  so now ParallelMesh users can use serializing I/O safely and will benefit when it gets more parallelized under the hood.
MeshData is now libmesh_deprecated()
Bug fix for ambiguous var name
Added Parallel::barrier() to synchronize before creating an Xdr object to avoid errors in parallel.
Fixes for compiler warnings
Fixed incorrect if-statement in boundary_id() and boundary_ids() functions.

Removed the QNTransient classes from rbOOmit. These classes are too specific to live in libMesh  they should be viewed more as an rbOOmit-based application code. Also  wrapped F_q  A_q and M_q representor initializations in if-tests to prevent potential memory leaks.
rbOOmit change: Pulled the basis dependent Riesz representors out of RBSystem and subclasses  and moved them into RBEvaluation and subclasses.
Cleaned up the code for clearing RB systems. It can mostly now be done by clearing the associated RBEvaluation object  do not need the complicated clear_basis_dependent_data etc any more.
Added clear_riesz_representors() to RBEvaluation to clear the Riesz representor vectors used in computing the residual in the RB method. This can allow us to save memory when we train many bases.
rbOOmit change: Moved Fq_representor_norms from RBEvaluation into RBSystem  since they are not basis dependent
add callback for extra send_list entries
cleanup refinement flags on init and read
rbOOmit change: Changed DerivedRBEvaluation so that clear resets residual_type_flag to RESIDUAL_WRT_UBER. This can be important in hp calculations  for example.
Use LibMeshInit
System::print_info now outputs some DofMap information about sparsity and constraints

Changed some DenseMatrix methods so they behave with empty matrices. rbOOmit change: Modified the train_reduced_basis method so that it starts with N=0  also had to change RB_solve so it works for N=0  changed default error bound mode to absolute rather than relative.

rbOOmit change: added resize_RB_data in RBEvaluation  which clears and resizes all the data that depends on the reduced basis space. This allows us to change the amount of data a given RBEvaluation can hold.
fix newline warning
return value warning on gcc-4.1 fixed.
If we read system data from a file that has fewer variables than our current system  let's remap that data onto our own variables of the same name.  This enables physics-upgrading restarts.

Major rbOOmit revision: removed the function-pointer based assembly and replaced it with object-based assembly via RBTheta and ElemAssembly. This approach is much more flexible. Made corresponding changes in ex23.
Nemesis reader now reads sidesets.
Don't call ex_get_side_set unless there are sidesets to get  otherwise Exodus prints an annoying warning.
Fixed overzealous assert.
Need to also read and write header information in order to do correct basis function IO in RBEvaluation.
Nemesis now reads nodesets.
Only check for PETSC_ARCH (and disable PETSc if not present) in PETSc 2.x builds.
Increment reference counter if the copy constructor is called
Call base class copy constructor  otherwise compiler warns in dbg mode...
Fix for false negatives in Tet::is_child_on_side
Exodus files also call Quad4's "quad4" in addition to QUAD  QUAD4  and quad.
Made the compile line more modular.
Nemesis no longer trusts the input file to tell it the mesh dimension... instead it determines that from the dimensions of all the elements it actually reads in.
Fix memory leak reported by valgrind.
avoid cast warning on gcc-4.1
Derek's fixes for ParallelMesh stuff.
We need to call is_child_on_side() from the parent for it to be correct on tets  due to the diagonal selection trick.
Use the correct configure result for xz support
Better (and race-condition-free when two apps read the same zipped file at once...) xz/bzip2 support
Tagging 0.7.1-rc1
Left pad filenames with zeroes to match nemesis behavior.
avoid divide by 0 for explicit sytems
Derek's fixes for --disable-amr.
Changes log from 0.7.0->0.7.1
Changed plotting from GMV to ExodusII.
Revert accidental turning on of verbose mode in Nemesis_IO.
Fix for --disable-amr --disable-periodic
.) Implemented partitioning for ParallelMesh.
UnstructuredMesh does not need to redefine partition() if it does not extend it.
add ability to insert extra ghosted dofs
allow for turning off partitioning
We want to use LIBMESH_OPTIONS everywhere - start_in_debugger is nice...
Fix for now-overzealous assertion: we can read_additional_data even on systems with already-initialized vectors.
Disable some AMR-only examples when --disable-amr is used
Fix for inefficient send_list bug with --disable-amr
Some more flexible quiet/verbose options for DiffSolver
remove debug printing
actually implement BoundingBox::intersect()
Fix for PointLocatorTree application to non-planar 2D meshes
Don't call redistribute  etc. if this is actually a serial mesh but libmesh was configured with --enable-parmesh.
Fix global Parallel::set_union() implementation
Fix for how-the-hell-did-this-compile-for-me error in global Parallel::set_union
Handle repartitioning of fewer-elements-than-processors non-serial meshes
Need to disable ParallelMesh non-serial repartitioning for 0.7.1  it'll need a lot of work before it works with refinement.
Fix test for std::hash
Don't catch exceptions in ex26/ex27  we don't expect convergence failures but we do expect possible logic bugs when developing
Make sure parallel_only() failures occur at a libmesh_assert() which gives us a nice stack trace  not at a weird internal MPI buffer size mismatch error.
Adding Elem::replace_child  to make ParallelMesh modification code easier
Partitioner::partition is parallel_only()
prepare_for_use() is parallel_only
Copy constructor bugfix  extra assertions for ParallelMesh
Bugfixes for ParallelMesh copy constructor
Fix for SerialMesh::delete_node()
Fixes for ParallelMesh::all_first_order().  Not good enough to make plot_error() work with a non-serial ParallelMesh  but we're getting closer...
Update libmesh_example_asserts for PETSc-only code
TypeVector with LIBMESH_DIM < 3 no longer mollycoddles weak code.
Many library changes to optimize  and conform to new stricter --enable-2D-only TypeVector behavior
really fix BoundingBox::intersect()
Fix that BoundingBox::intersect test for LIBMESH_DIM < 3
Make ex1 -o option more robust  actually test it in "make run".
add BoundingBox::contains_point... taking into account Roy's changes to intersect
Cleaned up and clarified a few comments
Add some comments to remind us about a thread safety gotcha when we multithread these loops
Fix and API change to make MeshBase::point_locator() thread-safe
We can't always link examples until the library's been built
Efficiency improvements (and a few const-correctness improvements) for periodic boundaries code
A slightly lower tolerance still gives good default results
Restoring (deprecated) point_locator() for backwards compatibility  new thread safe function is now sub_point_locator()
Tagging libMesh 0.7.1 (hopefully final)
